intro: Piptocarpha canescens, commonly known as the silverleaf globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Piptocarpha canescens is adapted to arid environments and is drought-tolerant, making it a hardy plant in xeriscaped landscapes.
